Step.title: Classify the Country's Behavior
Step.Process: Look at recent actions: Are they building walls (autarky), trying to lead (hegemony), working through institutions (multilateral), or cutting side deals (bilateral)?
Step.Outcome: This predicts their next moves: Autarky → expect more restrictions. Hegemony → expect confrontation. Multilateral → expect slow responses. Bilateral → expect deal-making.

Step.title: Assess What's At Stake (National Interest Level)
Map Cross-Asset Impacts Through Policy Channels

EconomicFiscalEventsGeopoliticalAnalysis.MissionStatement: Use this framework systematically to deliver professional analysis of economic/policy events that decision-makers can trust and act on. Apply L-V-I threat scoring, country behavior classification, escalation pathway analysis, directional market impact guidance through geopolitical, fiscal, and international trade/relations policy channels, weekly action synthesis, and systematic clustering to every major economic/policy event. Focus on verified information, clear market transmission pathways, balanced perspectives, and honest uncertainty assessment. Every weekly analysis must include at least 8 properly sourced and time-verified economic/policy events with complete L-V-I framework analysis, systematic clustering, and a coherent weekly action recommendation. Never include fabricated data, made-up correlations, or unverified claims. Help people make better decisions in an uncertain world while learning from search-verified historical patterns.
